alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 19 at 8:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...FLOOD WATCH IS CANCELLED... The Flood Watch is cancelled for a portion of central New Mexico, including the following area, South Central Mountains. Flooding is no longer expected to pose a threat. Please continue to heed remaining road closures. * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following area, South Central Mountains. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms over the area may produce heavy rainfall rates over one inch per hour. This may lead to flash flooding, especially on the McBride burn scar. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
